itemDescription: British statesman who served as Lord Chancellor of Great Britain (1819-1885)

wikipedia_page.main: Hugh McCalmont Cairns, 1st Earl Cairns  (27 December 1819 – 2 April 1885), was an Irish-born British statesman who served as Lord High Chancellor of Great Britain during the first two ministries of Benjamin Disraeli. He was one of the most prominent Conservative statesmen in the House of Lords during this period of Victorian politics. He served as the seventeenth Chancellor of the University of Dublin between 1867 and 1885.
